results.title: You only live twice
results.creator_credit: Ken Adam, Lewis Gilbert, Harry Saltzman, EON and United Artists Corporation
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “James Bond”.
The head of the evil SPECTRE organisation- Ernest Blofeld (Donald Pleasence), has mastermined a plan that could lead to World War 111. He’s using a rocketship to seize manned space missions from Earth’s orbit, causing them to mysteriously disappear. The world’s superpowers, America and Russian- unbeknownst of Blofeld’s plans, suspect one another and as the suspicion mounts, the world teeters on the brink of war. Enter suave, smooth and sophisticated secret agent 007 (Sean Connery) who, accompanied by an attractive Japanese agent Kissy Suzuki (Mie Hama) and scores of Ninja warriors plan a daring attack on Blofeld’s headquarters nestled in an inactive volcano. Screenplay by Roald Dahl and title song performed by Nancy Sinatra. Cast includes Tetsuro Tamba, Akiko Wakabayashi, Karin Dor, Bernard Lee and Desmond Llewellyn.

results.title: Octopussy (Special edition)
results.creator_credit: John Glen, Albert R. Broccoli and Danjaq
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “James Bond”.
Starting with an impressive sequence involving a small plane and a closing hangar, “Octopussy” also crosses the countries of East Berlin and Delhi and culminates in a train sequence then a big top. When an agent is found dead in East Berlin clutching a Faberge egg, British intelligence is alerted to the flurry of fake Faberges on the market from an unknown source - possibly Russian (alarm bells ring). The mission is code-named Operation Treasure Trove; Secret agent 007 (Roger Moore) placed in charge of proceedings. His mission takes him to Delhi in pursuit of exiled Indian Prince Kamal Khan (Louis Jordan), suspected owner of the Faberge eggs. He is not the top of the chain however, that honour lies with the mysterious Octopussy (Maud Adams), head of a floating harem of acrobatic women who have joined her sisterhood as a way of life, and agreed to taking part in smuggling jewellery and the circus Octopussy is running. Highlights include a snake charming agent, a hair raising tuk tuk ride, a jungle chase complete with elephants, tigers, snakes and a leech, death by circular saw, and the sight of Roger Moore in a clown suit.

results.title: Dr. No
results.creator_credit: Ken Adam, Terence Young, Albert R. Broccoli, Harry Saltzman and United Artists Corporation
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “James Bond”.
Dr. No was the first extraordinary adventure of the world’s most famous spy: James Bond. Sean Connery is 007: suave, charming and fearless; an expert on weapons, women, martinis and just about everything. Dr. No, a fanatical scientist, is a member of the terrorist organisation SPECTRE, which plans to conquer the world. However, thanks to the daring of James Bond, Dr. No is ultimately defeated. Ursula Andress made her screen debut in the film. While there is no famous title song, the well-known James Bond theme, elaborate opening title sequences by Maurice Binder and the magnificent locations were present from this first film and have now become part of the James Bond legend.

results.title: Goldeneye (Captioned)
results.creator_credit: Martin Campbell, Barbara Broccoli, Michael G. Wilson, United Artists Corporation and Danjaq
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “James Bond”.
Pierce Brosnan ignites the screen as the legendary James Bond in this explosive, thrill-packed adventure that hits the bulls-eye for nonstop excitement. When a deadly satellite weapon system falls into the wrong hands, only agent 007 can save the world from certain disaster. Cast includes Sean Bean, Izabella Scorupco and Famke Janssen.

results.title: Licence to kill (Special edition)
results.creator_credit: John Glen, Michael G. Wilson, Albert R. Broccoli, United Artists Corporation and Danjaq
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “James Bond”.
The happy nuptials of James’ CIA buddy Felix Leiter (David Hedison) and bride-to-be Della are rudely interrupted when they embark on a mercy dash to capture drug lord Franz Sanchez (Robert Davi). Thanks to some aerial fishing though, their mission is successful and the parachuting groomsmen make it in time for the wedding. The happy couple are soon devastated however when Sanchez escapes and kills the bride and maims the groom as payback. This triggers best buddy James (Timothy Dalton) to relinquish his secret service status and licence to kill authority (Bond is under orders to complete another mission) as he embarks on a personal vendetta to revenge Sanchez’s brutality towards his friends. Ably assisted by ex-Army pilot Pam Bouvier (Carey Lowell), Bond flies into Isthmus City to infiltrate himself into Sanchez’s posse where he discovers a television evangelist (Wayne Newton) providing a front for cocaine dealing. Featuring a plethora of water inspired stunts earlier on in the film, the cast also includes Benicio Del Toro as a brooding henchman and Talisa Soto as Lupe Lamore, Sanchez’s mistress, eye candy, and source of jealousy for Bouvier. This was Timothy Dalton’s last appearance as Bond.

results.title: On Her Majesty's secret service
results.creator_credit: Peter Hunt, Harry Saltzman, Albert R. Broccoli and Danjaq
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “James Bond”.
Bond is approached by a crime boss to marry his widowed daughter, Tracy, after hearing of the good deeds that Bond has demonstrated in saving his suicidal child. The father offers one million pounds, Bond asks for the location of Ernst Blofeld (Telly Savalas), head of SPECTRE in return. Disguised as a (kilted) genealogist with the College of Arms, Bond travels to Blofeld’s Alpine residence to discuss investigation into whether Blofeld is a legitimate count. Once there, Bond stumbles across a bizarre scene in which he dines with a room containing a bevy of beautiful women eating only one type of food. This is part of their treatment at Blofeld’s allergy treatment clinic that also includes late night brain-washing. The clinic is a sinister front - Blofeld is planning a bacteriological war. Features a car rally on ice with Diana Rigg in the driver’s seat, and plenty of down hill skiing and other snow-related action. In a departure from most Bond films, Bond (George Lazenby in his only performance as 007) actually falls for the girl, confessing his love and proposing, surviving a brief but ultimately tragic marriage.

results.title: Tomorrow never dies [Widescreen]
results.creator_credit: Roger Spottiswoode, Barbara Broccoli, Michael Wilson and Metro-Goldwyn-Mayer
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “James Bond”.
The 18th in the Bond series finds Bond (Pierce Brosnan) battling crazed media mogul Elliot Carver (Jonathan Pryce) who is intent on starting a war between England and China. His motivation - covering the event on his global satellite network and gaining kudos as the most powerful in current affairs and global business growth. Michelle Yeoh is the beautiful Wai Lin, a Chinese agent who teams up with Bond after crossing paths with him in her pursuit to find out what Carver really is up to. “Tomorrow never dies” is a fast paced action film full of over the top stunts and the usual comedy and sexual innuendo which will delight fans of 007. Cast also includes Dame Judi Dench, Teri Hatcher and Geoffrey Palmer.

results.title: Goldeneye
results.creator_credit: Martin Campbell, Barbara Broccoli, Michael G. Wilson and United Artists Corporation
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “James Bond”.
When a deadly satellite weapon falls into the wrong hands, only Agent 007 (Pierce Brosnan) can save the world from certain disaster. Armed with his license to kill and his smooth talking ways, Bond races to Russia in search of the stolen access codes for “GoldenEye”, the devastating satellite weapon. James Bond is pitted against an enemy who knows his every movement, a former agent, 006, trained in exactly the same methods and who can anticipate his every move. Alec Trevelyan (Sean Bean), agent 006 is motivated by a hatred that goes back years. 006 is not the only person causing Bond grief, he also battles with his former compatriot’s stunning ally, Xenia Onatopp (Famke Janssen), who crushes victims between her shapely but deadly thighs.

results.title: Casino royale
results.creator_credit: Robert Parrish, Joseph McGrath, Ken Hughes, Val Guest, John Huston, Jerry Bresler, Charles K. Feldman and Famous Artists Productions
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “James Bond”.
The greatest spy in history, Sir James Bond, has long since retired. The stuttering super spy now content with his garden and afternoons of classical music. His legend has lived on with his namesakes populating the continent, only of late, 11 of them have disappeared under dubious circumstances. Sir James (David Niven) is reluctantly brought out of retirement after the demise of M (John Huston) and faces fierce opposition in the form of an army of beautiful women but manages to make it back to MI5. Once there, he implements an anti-female spy device but he too is captured by SMERSH. A further measure includes naming all spies, including the girls, James Bond 007, to throw the opposition off the scent. Bond blackmails the beautiful Vesper Lynd (Bond regular Ursula Andress) to use her feminine wiles on Baccarat champion Evelyn Tremble (Peter Sellers) to defeat Le Chiffre (Orson Welles) who is bankrolling the activities of SMERSH. Notable cameos include Woody Allen as Jimmy Bond, James’ neurotic nephew lost in the Caribbean and Deborah Kerr as French spy Mimi. Whilst based on an Ian Fleming novel, “Casino royale” was the only Bond novel not sold to Eon Productions and it was deemed that the only film to rival a true Bond film was a parody. The effect was met with mixed reviews and the film does suffer from having five directors at the helm. However, scenes involving Peter Sellers are particularly entertaining. Soundtrack by Burt Bacharach.

results.title: The Living daylights (Special edition)
results.creator_credit: John Glen, Michael G. Wilson, Albert R. Broccoli and Danjaq
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “James Bond”.
Touted as a possible replacement to the outgoing original Bond - Sean Connery - Timothy Dalton gave way to Roger Moore because he thought he looked too young for the role and didn’t appear until 14 years later in “The Living daylights”. Marking a more brutal instalment than usual, the film starts with a game of paintball gone wrong then moves to Czechoslovakia where Bond is entrusted with protecting the life of defecting former KGB agent Georgi Koskov (Jeroen Krabbe) who is being targeted by a sniper. When the sniper turns out to be a beautiful blonde cellist, Bond is content to wing her and pursue her later for further information. Safely back in the UK, Koskov is kidnapped and disappears, but not before he tells British Intelligence of a plot by fellow KGB agent General Leonid Pushkin (John Rhys-Davies) to assassinate British and American agents in a bid to start a nuclear war. 007 is ordered to carry out the termination issued against Pushkin, based on evidence which he considers dubious. When the name of an American arms dealer is mentioned, the plot thickens. Notable scenes include a particularly grisly death by automatic door and tobogganing on a cello case. It was also the last Bond film to use one of Ian Fleming’s original story titles. Cast also includes Maryam D’Abo, Joe Don Baker and Art Malik.
